subject: Fashion
title: Recycled Polyester Pros and Cons
description: One-minute skill: Recycled Polyester Pros and Cons.

hook.text: Recycled polyester turns old plastic bottles into fabric. Sounds heroic. The reality is more mixed.

buildup.text: Making recycled poly uses 59% less energy than virgin polyester and diverts plastic from landfills.

discovery.text: But recycled polyester still sheds microplastics in every wash, just like virgin polyester does.

twist.text: Worse, recycled polyester clothing can rarely be recycled again. The bottle-to-shirt pipeline is a dead end.

climax.text: Calling it 'recycled' lets consumers feel virtuous, but it delays the real fix: using less synthetic fabric.

punchline.text: Recycled polyester: a better start, not a solution.

quiz.question: What happens to recycled polyester clothing at the end of its life?
options: It can be recycled into new polyester fabric indefinitely
It biodegrades within a few years in standard landfills
It can rarely be recycled again, making the process a dead end
